I have never eaten as much food as I did travelling to all the Radisson hotels in South Africa.

To say that the hotel group pride themselves on their gastronomic experiences on offer to guests is an understatement - but they have the right to boast. From their three hotels in Cape Town to their Port Elizabeth property to their two Sandton offerings, their chefs and bartenders can whip up some of the most delicious dishes in the country.

READ: From waitress to executive housekeeper at the Radisson: How this super-mom of five didn't give up

And they don't shy away from dietary requirements either - in fact it's almost seen as a challenge to the chef to come up with just-as-delicious alternatives to suit each appetite.

In Port Elizabeth you can make your own pizza, in Cape Town you can opt for star sign cocktails at Residence, delight in local flavour on Radisson Red's rooftop, get yourself into a sugar coma at Waterfront's Sunday Buffet (which I happily did), learn how to plate a starter at Sandton and indulge in cityscape views at Radisson Blu Gautrain.

Despite being part of a global group, these hotels all have their own distinctive identity, fitting into their surroundings and taking on the local flavour. Talking to the chefs and bartenders behind the food and cocktail creations, the passion is as evident in person as it is in their food, and Radisson is capitalising on it.

And when you're done gorging yourself, hit up the Amani Spa in Port Elizabeth and Waterfront to help massage all those calories away.

WATCH: Always say 'yes' to a Radisson RED party

Here are a few must-try dishes at each hotel:

Port Elizabeth

Milk and honey ice cream dessert with honey crumble.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Oh Honey Bee cocktail with Espolon tequila, Fabbri sweet and sour mix, Martini Bianco, Fabbri strawberry and soda water.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Cape Town Residence

Piña colada from Ghibli bar.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Lamb served with broccoli stems at the Tobago's Restaurant.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Radisson Red Silo

Butternut gnocchi with goats cheese sauce and deep-fried sage leaves.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Legally Green salad with green beans, baby peas, baby spinach, avocado, garlic chips and a lemon and caper dressing.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Waterfront

Salted caramel cake with a bottom layer of cheesecake at the Sunday Lunch buffet.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Biltong-spiced beef fillet with blue cheese croquette, pumpkin puree, charred butternut and herb pomme anna jus.

Sandton

Lemon and pea risotto at their Vivace Restaurant.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Grilled sea bass in a coconut chilli and lime sauce, tender stem broccoli, orange and fennel salad and squid ink caviar.

(Photo: Gabi Zietsman)

Gautrain

Deconstructed cheesecake and the Cape Malay lamb curry.
